Name: Figure of Isis with her son Horus as a child
Description: Bronze figure of the goddess Isis with her child Horus on her lap. The goddess wears a vulture head-dress with cobra, topped by a modius supporting the horned sun-disk. She is suckling the child from her left breast. This is one of the most popular types of image in the Late Period. Bronze figures of deities were deposited as votive offerings in shrines to deities throughout Egypt in large numbers at this time.
